</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	The Company's earnings per diluted share were
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	$0.55
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	$2.70
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	$2.86
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;for the years ended December 31, 2016, 2015 and 2014, respectively. The non-comparable items presented below are calculated after tax using the corresponding effective tax rate and the weighted average number of diluted shares for each of the years then ended. 	&#8226;

</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	In the fourth quarter of 2016, the Company determined that its best estimate of the aggregate liability both for asbestos-related claims asserted but not yet resolved and potential asbestos-related claims not yet asserted, including an estimate for defense costs, is
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	$879.3 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;as of December 31, 2016. The Company recorded a charge of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	$703.6 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;before tax (
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	$440.6 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;after tax) in Other Expense, representing the difference in the total liability from what was previously accrued, consulting fees, less available insurance coverage. Refer to Note 14, "Contingencies," to the Consolidated Financial Statements in Item 8 of this report for more information.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

	$10.3 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;related to the Engine segment, primarily driven by the decision to discontinue the use of an unamortized trade name.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:48PX;">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;PADDING-LEFT:24PX;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#8226;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	The Company incurred a settlement loss of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	$3.1 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;related to lump-sum payments made to former employees of the Company to discharge its obligation under the U.S pension plan.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">

<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:48PX;">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>

<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:11PT;PADDING-LEFT:24PX;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#8226;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	The Company recorded tax benefits of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	$15.3 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	$0.4 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	$1.1 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;related to restructuring expense, intangible asset impairment losses and the pension settlement loss, respectively.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#FFFFFF;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Net Sales
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	Net sales for the year ended December 31, 2016 totaled
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	$9,071.0 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	, a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	13.1%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;increase from the year ended December 31, 2015. Excluding the impact of weakening foreign currencies, and the 2015 Remy acquisition, net sales increased 5.2%.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	Net sales for the year ended December 31, 2015 totaled
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	$8,023.2 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	, a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	3.4%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;decrease from the year ended December 31, 2014. Excluding the impact of weakening foreign currencies, primarily the Euro, the 2014 Wahler acquisition, the 2015 BERU Diesel acquisition and the 2015 Remy acquisition, net sales increased 4.3%.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>

	&#32;in the years ended December 31, 2016, 2015 and 2014, respectively. The Company's material cost of sales was approximately 55% of net sales in the years ended December 31, 2016, 2015 and 2014.&#160;The Company's remaining cost to convert raw material to finished product, which includes direct labor and manufacturing overhead, had continued to improve during the years ended December 31, 2016 and 2015 compared to 2014. Gross profit as a percentage of net sales was

	&#32;in the years ended December 31, 2016, 2015 and 2014, respectively. Included in the 2016 gross profit and gross margin is a $6.2 million gain associated with the release of certain Remy light vehicle aftermarket liabilities related to the expiration of a customer contract.

	programs, all of which are necessary for short- and long-term growth. Our current long-term expectation for R&amp;D spending is approximately 4% of net sales.

</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;in the years ended December 31, 2016, 2015 and 2014, respectively. This line item is driven by the results of our 50%-owned Japanese joint venture, NSK-Warner, and our 32.6%-owned Indian joint venture, Turbo Energy Private Limited (&#8220;TEL&#8221;). The increase in the year ended December 31, 2016 compared to 2015 and 2014 is primarily driven by higher earnings from NSK-Warner as a result of improved business conditions in Asia. Refer to Note 5, "Balance Sheet Information," to the Consolidated Financial Statements in Item 8 of this report for further discussion of NSK-Warner.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">

	were

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	$60.4 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	$36.4 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;in the years ended December 31, 2016, 2015 and 2014, respectively. The increase in interest expense for the year ended December 31, 2016 compared with the years ended December 31, 2015 and 2014 was primarily due to the Company's March and November 2015 issuances of senior notes.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Provision for income taxes
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;The provision for income taxes resulted in an effective tax rate of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	15.9%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;for the year ended December 31, 2016, compared with rates of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	30.3%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	29.9%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;for the years ended December 31, 2015 and 2014, respectively.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	The effective tax rate of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	15.9%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;for the year ended December 31, 2016 includes tax benefits of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	$263.0 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	$22.7 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	$8.6 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	$6.0 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	$4.4 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;associated with an asbestos-related charge, loss on divestiture, other one-time tax adjustments, restructuring expense and intangible asset impairment loss, respectively, as well as a tax expense of $2.2 million related to a gain associated with the release of certain Remy light vehicle aftermarket liabilities due to the expiration of a customer contract. Excluding the impact of these non-comparable items, the Company's annual effective tax rate associated with ongoing operations for 2016 was 30.9%.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	The effective tax rate of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	30.3%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;for the year ended December 31, 2015 includes tax benefits of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	$9.0 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	$3.8 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	$3.7 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;related to the pension settlement loss, merger and acquisition expense and restructuring expense discussed in Note 3, "Other Expense, Net," to the Consolidated Financial Statements in Item 8 of the report. Additionally, the effective tax rate includes a tax benefit of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	$9.9 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;primarily related to foreign tax incentives and tax settlements. Excluding the impact of these non-comparable items, the Company's annual effective tax rate associated with ongoing operations for 2015 was 29.8%.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	The effective tax rate of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	29.9%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;for the year ended December 31, 2014 includes tax benefits of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	$15.3 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	$0.4 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	$1.1 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;related to restructuring expense, intangible asset impairment losses and the pension settlement loss discussed in Note 3, "Other Expense, Net," to the Consolidated Financial Statements in Item 8 of this report. Excluding the impact of these non-comparable items, the Company's annual effective tax rate associated with ongoing operations for 2014 was 28.5%.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Net earnings attributable to the noncontrolling interest, net of tax
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	$41.7 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;for the year ended December 31, 2016 increased by
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	$5.0 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	$10.0 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;compared to the years ended December 31, 2015 and 2014, respectively. The increase during the year ended December 31, 2016 compared to the years ended December 31, 2015 and 2014 was primarily related to higher sales and earnings by the Company's joint ventures.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>

</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	33
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#FF0000;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&#160;&#160;
</FONT>

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

<HR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
<A NAME="eolPage34"></A>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;TEXT-INDENT:288PX;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;COLOR:#FF0000;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:12PT;COLOR:#FF0000;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Results By Reporting Segment
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	The Company's business is comprised of two reporting segments: Engine and Drivetrain. These segments are strategic business groups, which are managed separately as each represents a specific grouping of related automotive components and systems.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	The Company allocates resources to each segment based upon the projected after-tax return on invested capital ("ROIC") of its business initiatives. ROIC is comprised of Adjusted EBIT after deducting notional taxes compared to the projected average capital investment required. Adjusted EBIT is comprised of earnings before interest, income taxes and noncontrolling interest (&#8220;EBIT") adjusted for restructuring, goodwill impairment charges, affiliates' earnings and other items not reflective of ongoing operating income or loss.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	Adjusted EBIT is the measure of segment income or loss used by the Company. The Company believes Adjusted EBIT is most reflective of the operational profitability or loss of our reporting segments.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	The following tables show segment information and Adjusted EBIT for the Company's reporting segments.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Inter-segment eliminations

<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BORDER-BOTTOM:3PX DOUBLE #000000;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#CCEEFF;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BORDER-BOTTOM:3PX DOUBLE #000000;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#CCEEFF;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	609.7
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BORDER-BOTTOM:3PX DOUBLE #000000;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#CCEEFF;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

</FONT>
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	34
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#FF0000;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<HR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
<A NAME="eolPage35"></A>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;TEXT-INDENT:288PX;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;COLOR:#FF0000;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:12PT;COLOR:#FF0000;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	The
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Engine
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;segment's net sales for the year ended December 31, 2016 increased
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	$90.1 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	, or
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	1.6%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	, and segment Adjusted EBIT increased
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	$33.4 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	, or
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	3.7%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	, from the year ended December 31, 2015. Excluding the impact of weakening foreign currencies, primarily the Euro, Chinese Renminbi and Korean Won, net sales increased 3.1% from the year ended December 31, 2015 primarily due to higher sales of light vehicle turbochargers and engine timing systems, including variable cam timing, partially offset by weak aftermarket and commercial vehicle markets around the world. The segment Adjusted EBIT margin was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	16.7%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;for the year ended December 31, 2016, up from
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	16.4%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;in the year ended December 31, 2015.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	The Engine segment's net sales for the year ended December 31, 2015 decreased
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	$205.9 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	, or
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	3.6%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	, and segment Adjusted EBIT decreased
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	$23.3 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	, or
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	2.5%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	, from the year ended December 31, 2014. Excluding the impact of weakening foreign currencies, primarily the Euro, the 2014 Wahler acquisition and the 2015 BERU Diesel acquisition, net sales increased 6.7% from the year ended December 31, 2014 primarily due to higher sales of turbochargers, partially offset by weak commercial vehicle markets around the world. The segment Adjusted EBIT margin was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	16.4%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;for the year ended December 31, 2015, up from
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	16.2%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;in the year ended December 31, 2014.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	The
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Drivetrain
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;segment's net sales for the year ended December 31, 2016 increased
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	$967.0 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	, or
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	37.8%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	, and segment Adjusted EBIT increased
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	$59.9 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	, or
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	20.3%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	, from the year ended December 31, 2015. Excluding the impact of weakening foreign currencies, primarily the Euro, Chinese Renminbi and Korean Won, and the 2015 Remy acquisition, net sales increased 9.9% from the year ended December 31, 2015 primarily due to higher sales of all-wheel drive systems. The segment Adjusted EBIT margin was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	10.1%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;in the year ended December 31, 2016, compared to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	11.5%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;in the year ended December 31, 2015. The Adjusted EBIT margin decrease was primarily due to the 2015 acquisition of Remy.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	The Drivetrain segment's net sales for the year ended December 31, 2015 decreased
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	$74.7 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	, or
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	2.8%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	, and segment Adjusted EBIT decreased
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	$8.7 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	, or
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	2.9%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	, from the year ended December 31, 2014. Excluding the impact of weakening foreign currencies, primarily the Euro, and the 2015 Remy acquisition, net sales decreased 0.8% from the year ended December 31, 2014 primarily due to lower sales of transmission components in Europe. The segment Adjusted EBIT margin was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	11.5%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;in the year ended December 31, 2015, compared to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	11.5%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;in the year ended December 31, 2014.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Corporate
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;represents headquarters' expenses not directly attributable to the individual segments and equity in affiliates' earnings. This net expense was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	$132.1 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	$113.2 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	$112.1 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;for the years ended December 31, 2016, 2015 and 2014, respectively. The increase of Corporate expenses in 2016 is primarily due to costs associated with the onboarding and severance of talent, compliance costs and various other corporate investment initiatives.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<A NAME="A10K12312016_HTM_SFEE06A89864D5CB8A35C5C39F866F755">
</A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Outlook
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	Our overall outlook for 2017 is positive. The Company expects modest global production growth and net new business-related sales growth in 2017 due to rapid adoption of BorgWarner products around the world. This growth is expected to be partially offset by a stronger U.S. dollar, which would reduce the U.S. dollar value of its foreign currency-denominated sales.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	The Company maintains a positive long-term outlook for its global business and is committed to new product development and strategic capital investments to enhance its product leadership strategy. The several trends that are driving our long-term growth are expected to continue, including the increased turbocharger adoption in North American and Asia, the increased adoption of automated transmissions in Europe and Asia-Pacific, and the move to variable cam and chain engine timing systems in Europe and Asia-Pacific. Our long-term growth is also expected to benefit from the adoption of product offerings for hybrid and electric vehicles.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	35
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#FF0000;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>

</EFX_RESULTS_OF_OPERATIONS>
<A NAME="eolPage36"></A>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;TEXT-INDENT:288PX;FONT-SIZE:12PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;COLOR:#FF0000;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:12PT;COLOR:#FF0000;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;&#32;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<A NAME="A10K12312016_HTM_S1A7136C2846F5813A7BFD85543B3769B">
</A>
</DIV>
<EFX_LIQUIDITY_CAPITAL>
<A NAME="FIS_LIQUIDITY_CAPITAL"></A>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	LIQUIDITY AND CAPITAL RESOURCES
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	The Company maintains various liquidity sources including cash and cash equivalents and the unused portion of our multi-currency revolving credit agreement. At December 31, 2016, the Company had
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	$443.7 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;of cash, of which $437.1 million of cash was held by our subsidiaries outside of the United States. Cash held by these subsidiaries is used to fund foreign operational activities and future investments, including acquisitions. The vast majority of cash held outside the United States is available for repatriation, however, doing so could result in increased foreign and U.S. federal, state and local income taxes. A deferred tax liability has been recorded for the portion of these funds anticipated to be repatriated to the United States. The Company uses its U.S. liquidity primarily for various corporate purposes, including but not limited to, debt service, share repurchases, dividend distributions and other corporate expenses.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	The Company has a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	$1 billion
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	multi-currency revolving credit facility which includes a feature that allows the Company's borrowings to be increased to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	$1.25 billion
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	The facility provides for borrowings through June 30, 2019. The Company has one key financial covenant as part of the credit agreement which is a debt to EBITDA ("Earnings Before Interest, Taxes, Depreciation and Amortization") ratio.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	The Company was in compliance with the financial covenant at December 31, 2016 and expects to remain compliant in future periods. At December 31, 2016 and December 31, 2015, the Company had no outstanding borrowings under this facility.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	The Company's commercial paper program allows the Company to issue short-term, unsecured commercial paper notes up to a maximum aggregate principal amount outstanding of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	$1 billion
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	Under this program, the Company may issue notes from time to time and will use the proceeds for general corporate purposes.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	At December 31, 2016 and 2015, the Company had outstanding borrowings of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	$50.8 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	$215.0 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	, respectively,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	under this program, which is classified in the Consolidated Balance Sheets in Notes payable and other short-term debt.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;&#32;&#32;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	The total current combined borrowing capacity under the multi-currency revolving credit facility and commercial paper program cannot exceed
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	$1 billion
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	In addition to the credit facility, the Company's universal shelf registration has an unlimited amount of various debt and equity instruments that could be issued.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	On February 10, 2016, April 27, 2016 and July 26, 2016, the Company&#8217;s Board of Directors declared quarterly cash dividends of $0.13 per share of common stock. On November 9, 2016, the Company's Board of Directors declared quarterly cash dividends of $0.14 per share of common stock. These dividends were paid in the 12 months ended December 31, 2016.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	The Company's net debt to net capital ratio was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	35.0%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;at December 31, 2016 versus
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	35.2%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;at December 31, 2015.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	From a credit quality perspective, the Company has a credit rating of BBB+ from both Standard &amp; Poor's and Fitch Ratings and Baa1 from Moody's. The current outlook from Standard &amp; Poor's and Fitch Ratings is stable. During the first quarter of 2016, Moody's revised its outlook from stable to negative. None of the Company's debt agreements require accelerated repayment in the event of a downgrade in credit ratings.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:9PT;">
	36
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#FF0000;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>

	$134.0 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">

</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	$196.8 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;decrease in balance sheet debt (net of cash) was primarily due to the repayment of the Company's $150 million 5.75% Senior Notes and other short term borrowings.

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#FFFFFF;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Operating Activities
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	Net cash provided by operating activities was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	$1,035.7 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	$867.9 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	$801.8 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;in the years ended December 31, 2016, 2015 and 2014, respectively. The increase for the year ended December 31, 2016 compared with the year ended December 31, 2015 primarily reflects higher net earnings adjusted for non-cash charges to operations and improved working capital resulting from inventory management initiatives and product mix change. The increase for the year ended December 31, 2015 compared with the year ended December 31, 2014 primarily reflects improved working capital, partially offset by lower net earnings adjusted for non-cash charges to operations.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">

</FONT>
</DIV>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Investing Activities
</FONT>

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">

</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	Net cash used in investing activities was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	$404.2 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	$1,759.1 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	$665.1 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;in the years ended December 31, 2016, 2015 and 2014, respectively. The decrease in the year ended December 31, 2016 compared with the year ended December 31, 2015 is primarily due to lower capital expenditures, including tooling outlays, the 2016 sale of Divgi-Warner and Remy light vehicle aftermarket business and the 2015 acquisition of Remy and BERU Diesel. The increase in the year ended December 31, 2015 compared with the year ended December 31, 2014 is primarily driven by the 2015 acquisitions of Remy and BERU Diesel and higher capital expenditures, partially offset by the 2014 acquisition of Wahler and a gain on the settlement of net investment hedges in 2015. Year over year capital spending decrease of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	$76.7 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;during the year ended December 31, 2016 is due to lower spending on new buildings and building expansions. Year over year capital spending increase of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	$14.3 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;during the year ended December 31, 2015 was primarily due to higher spending levels required to meet increased program launches worldwide.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Financing Activities
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	Net cash used in financing activities was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	$733.8 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;for the year ended December 31, 2016, net cash provided by financing activities was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	$736.6 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;for the year ended December 31, 2015 and net cash used in financing activities was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	$201.7 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;for the year ended December 31, 2014. The decrease in the year ended December 31, 2016 compared with the year ended December 31, 2015 is primarily driven by lower debt borrowings and higher debt repayments, partially offset by lower treasury stock purchases. The increase in the year ended December 31, 2015 compared with the year ended December 31, 2014 is primarily driven by the $1 billion issuance of senior notes in March 2015 and the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#8364;500 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	&#32;issuance of senior notes in November 2015, partially offset by the decrease in notes payable, treasury stock purchases and dividend payments.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	The Company's significant contractual obligation payments at December 31, 2016 are as follows:
</FONT>
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:24PX;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	We believe that the combination of cash from operations, cash balances, available credit facilities, and the universal shelf registration capacity will be sufficient to satisfy our cash needs for our current level of operations and our planned operations for the foreseeable future. We will continue to balance our needs for internal growth, external growth, debt reduction and cash conservation.
